Event.name: Transition_to_a_situation
Event.definition:
<def-root>An <fen>Entity</fen> ends up in a <fen>Final_situation</fen>.
<ex><fex name="Entity">I</fex> have <t>come</t> <fex name="Final_situation">to appreciate good coffee</fex> .</ex> <ex><fex name="Entity">We</fex> have <t>come</t> <fex name="Final_situation">to expect three meals a day</fex> .</ex> <ex>When <fex name="Entity">the history of our times</fex> <t>comes</t> <fex name="Final_situation">to be written</fex> , They Organized Themselves to Death will be the only possible epitaph . </ex> <ex></ex> This frame should be compared to the more general Transition_to_a_state, which also includes changes to a Final_category and a Final_quality. <ex></ex> This frame should be compared to Process_start and Activity_start. Unlike Process_start's Process FE and Activity_start's Activity FE, the <fen>Final_situation</fen> need not be conceived of as an ongoing event. Also, there is no emphasis on the temporal profiling in Transition_to_a_situation other than the before (where the <fen>Final_situation</fen> is not true) to the after (where the <fen>Final_situation</fen> is true).</def-root>

Arg.name: Time
Arg.definition:
<def-root>When the change occurs.
<ex><fex name="tim">By 1945</fex> he had <t>come</t> to doubt the advisability of anyone having such a weapon.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Manner
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any description of the event which is not covered by more specific FEs, including epistemic modification (<ment>probably, presumably, mysteriously</ment>), secondary effects (<ment>quietly, loudly</ment>), and general descriptions comparing events (<ment>the same way</ment>). In cases where the <fen>Entity</fen> is intentional, <fen>Manner</fen> may indicate salient characteristics of an intentional <fen>Entity</fen> that also affect the event (<ment>presumptuously, coldly, deliberately, eagerly, carefully</ment>).
<ex>The majority <fex name="man">slowly</fex> <t>came</t> to understand him.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Entity
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen> which undergoes a change, ending up in the <fen>Final_situation</fen>.
<ex><fex name="ent">I</fex> am <t>coming</t> to loathe your insolence.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Transitional_period
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The period during which the <fen>Entity</fen> is in transition.
<ex><fex name="trp">Over the next three years</fex> she <t>came</t> to represent the hope of latinos everywhere .</ex> </def-root>

Arg.name: Circumstances
Arg.definition: <def-root>This FE marks the set of conditions under which the <fen>Entity</fen> enters the <fen>Final_situation</fen>.</def-root>

Arg.name: Group
Arg.definition: <def-root>The type of individual things that have an instance of the <fen>Entity</fen> and which are saliently affected by its change.</def-root>

Arg.name: Explanation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>Any eventuality or entity which brings about the change of the <fen>Entity</fen>.
<ex>Smithers <t>came</t> to hate her <fex name="Explanation">because of all the work he'd been doing</fex>.</ex></def-root>

Arg.name: Final_situation
Arg.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Entity</fen>'s situation after the change.
<ex>My father <t>came</t> <fex name="Final_situation">to wonder why he 'd worked so hard</fex> .</ex></def-root>
